revised_title: The Role of Sensory Impressions and Sensory Centres in Voluntary Movements
tldr: The author argues against the existence of motor centres in the cerebral cortex and suggests that sensory impressions and the activity of sensory centres are the true guides for volitional action. He contends that true motor centres exist only in the pons, bulb, and spinal cord, which can be activated in different ways depending on the stimulus.
